result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Current probation if revoked

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Current probation if revoked

AMENDED 11-12-2014:  THIS TERM OF PROBATION IS CONCURRENT WITH CURRENT PROBATION.
Concurrent with: Current probation

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  Defendant must comply with Sex Offender Treatment.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
